briefdescription.para: The current force coefficients.

detaileddescription.para: The force coefficients at the current flight condition.

briefdescription.para: The current moment coefficients.

detaileddescription.para: The moment coefficients at the current flight condition.

briefdescription.para: Aerodynamic reference length.

detaileddescription.para: Reference length with which aerodynamic moments are non-dimensionalized.

briefdescription.para: Aerodynamic reference area.

detaileddescription.para: Reference area with which aerodynamic forces and moments are non-dimensionalized.

briefdescription.para: Lateral aerodynamic reference length.

detaileddescription.para: Lateral reference length with which aerodynamic moments are non-dimensionalized.

briefdescription.para: Aerodynamic reference lengths.

detaileddescription.para: All reference lengths with which aerodynamic moments are non-dimensionalized.

briefdescription.para: Aerodynamic moment reference point.

detaileddescription.para: Point w.r.t. which the arm of the moment on a vehicle panel is determined.
Vector with identifiers for the physical meaning of each independent variable of the aerodynamic coefficients.

briefdescription.para: Number of independent variables upon which the force and moment coefficients depend.

detaileddescription.para: Number of independent variables upon which the force and moment coefficients depend, i.e. the length of the vectors that should be used as input to updateCurrentCoefficients

briefdescription.para: Boolean to denote whether coefficients are defined in aerodynamic or body frame.

detaileddescription.para: Boolean to define whether the aerodynamic coefficients are defined in the aerodynamic frame (drag, side, lift force) or in the body frame (typically denoted as Cx, Cy, Cz).

briefdescription.para: Boolean to denote whether coefficients are positive along frame axes.

detaileddescription.para: Boolean to define whether the aerodynamic coefficients are positive along tyhe positive axes of the body or aerodynamic frame (see areCoefficientsInAerodynamicFrame). Note that for (drag, side, lift force), the coefficients are typically defined in negative direction.

briefdescription.para: List of control surface aerodynamic coefficient interfaces.
Explicit list of control surface names, in same order as iterator over controlSurfaceIncrementInterfaces_.

memberdef.argsstring: (const double referenceLength, const double referenceArea, const double lateralReferenceLength, const Eigen::Vector3d &momentReferencePoint, const std::vector< AerodynamicCoefficientsIndependentVariables > independentVariableNames, const bool areCoefficientsInAerodynamicFrame=true, const bool areCoefficientsInNegativeAxisDirection=true)
memberdef.name: AerodynamicCoefficientInterface

briefdescription.para: Constructor.

detaileddescription.para:
Constructor, sets quantities common to all derived class aerodynamic coefficient interfaces.
referenceLength
Reference length with which aerodynamic moments (about x- and z- axes) are non-dimensionalized.
referenceArea
Reference area with which aerodynamic forces and moments are non-dimensionalized.
lateralReferenceLength
Reference length with which aerodynamic moments (about y-axis) is non-dimensionalized.
momentReferencePoint
Point w.r.t. aerodynamic moment is calculated
independentVariableNames
Vector with identifiers the physical meaning of each independent variable of the aerodynamic coefficients.
areCoefficientsInAerodynamicFrame
Boolean to define whether the aerodynamic coefficients are defined in the aerodynamic frame (drag, side, lift force) or in the body frame (typically denoted as Cx, Cy, Cz) (default true).
areCoefficientsInNegativeAxisDirection
Boolean to define whether the aerodynamic coefficients are positive along tyhe positive axes of the body or aerodynamic frame (see areCoefficientsInAerodynamicFrame). Note that for (drag, side, lift force), the coefficients are typically defined in negative direction (default true).

briefdescription.para: Default destructor.
Get reference area.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns reference area used to non-dimensionalize aerodynamic forces and moments.
Aerodynamic reference area.

briefdescription.para: Get reference length.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns reference length used to non-dimensionalize aerodynamic moments.
Aerodynamic reference length.

briefdescription.para: Get lateral reference length.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns lateral reference length used to non-dimensionalize aerodynamic moments.
Aerodynamic lateral reference length.

briefdescription.para: Get reference lengths.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns the all reference lengths used to non-dimensionalize aerodynamic moments.
Aerodynamic reference lengths.

briefdescription.para: Get moment reference point.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns the point w.r.t. which the arm of the aerodynamic moment on a vehicle panel is determined.
Aerodynamic reference point.

briefdescription.para: Compute the aerodynamic coefficients of the body itself (without control surfaces) at current flight condition.

detaileddescription.para:
Computes the current force and moment coefficients of the body itself (without control surfaces) and is to be implemented in derived classes. Input is a set of independent variables (doubles) which represent the variables from which the coefficients are calculated
independentVariables
Independent variables of force and moment coefficient determination implemented by derived class
currentTime
Time to which coefficients are to be updated

briefdescription.para: Compute the aerodynamic coefficients for a single control surface, and add to full configuration coefficients.

detaileddescription.para:
Compures the aerodynamic coefficients for a single control surface at the current flight conditions, and adds these to the coefficients of the full configuration, stored in class instance by currentForceCoefficients_ and currentMomentCoefficients_ variables.
currentControlSurface
Name of control surface that is to be updated.
controlSurfaceIndependentVariables
Current values of independent variables of force and moment coefficient of given control surface.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::vector< double > &independentVariables, const std::map< std::string, std::vector< double > > &controlSurfaceIndependentVariables=std::map< std::string, std::vector< double > >(), const double currentTime=TUDAT_NAN)
memberdef.name: updateFullCurrentCoefficients

briefdescription.para: Function to update the aerodynamic coefficients of the full body with control surfaces.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to update the aerodynamic coefficients of the full body with control surfaces. The full body coefficients are cimputed first, after which the control surfaces are updated and the results added to the full coefficients.
independentVariables
Independent variables of force and moment coefficient of body without control surfaces
controlSurfaceIndependentVariables
Map of independent variables of force and moment coefficient of control surfaces, with map key denoting the control surface identifier.
currentTime
Time to which coefficients are to be updated.

briefdescription.para: Function for calculating and returning aerodynamic force coefficients.

detaileddescription.para:
Function for calculating and returning aerodynamic force coefficients.
Force coefficients at current independent variables

briefdescription.para: Function for calculating and returning aerodynamic moment coefficients.

detaileddescription.para:
Function for calculating and returning aerodynamic moment coefficients.
Moment coefficients at current independent variables

briefdescription.para: Function for calculating and returning aerodynamic force and moment coefficients.

detaileddescription.para:
Function for calculating and returning aerodynamic force and moment coefficients
Force and moment coefficients at given independent variables

briefdescription.para: Function to return the identifiers of the physical meaning of each independent variable.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to return the identifiers of the physical meaning of each independent variable of the aerodynamic coefficient interface.
A vector with the identifiers of the physical meaning of each independent variable.

briefdescription.para: Function to return a single identifier of the physical meaning of one independent variable.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to return a single identifier of the physical meaning of one of the independent independent variable of the coefficient interface. The index of the variable is defined by the input variable.
index
Index of list of identfiers to return
The identifiers of the physical meaning of the independent variable at the position of the input variable.

briefdescription.para: Function to return the number of independent variables upon which the coeficients depend.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to return the number of independent variables upon which the coeficients depend. The size of the vector used as input for updateCurrentCoefficients should always have the size returned by this variable.
Number of independent variables upon which the coeficients depend

briefdescription.para: Function that returns whether the coefficients are given in aerodynamic frame.

detaileddescription.para:
Function that returns whether the coefficients are given in aerodynamic frame (given in body) frame if false.
Boolean whether coefficients are in aerodynamic frame

briefdescription.para: Function that returns whether the coefficients are positive in positive axes directions.

detaileddescription.para:
Function that returns whether the coefficients are positive in positive axes directions, i.e. if positive force (in given frame) gives positive coefficients.
Boolean whether coefficients are in positive direction.

briefdescription.para: Function to set the list of control surface aerodynamic coefficient interfaces.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to set the list of control surface aerodynamic coefficient interfaces
controlSurfaceIncrementInterfaces
Map of ControlSurfaceIncrementAerodynamicInterface pointers, wach pointer denoting the coefficient interface of a single control sureface, where the map key denotes the surface's name.

briefdescription.para: Function to get control surface name at given index in list of control surfaces.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to get control surface name at given index in list of control surfaces
index
Index in list of control surfaces (controlSurfaceNames_)
Name of requested control surfaces.

briefdescription.para: Function to return the number of control surfaces in current coefficient interface.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to return the number of control surfaces in current coefficient interface.
Number of control surfaces in current coefficient interface.

briefdescription.para: Function to return the number of independent variables for a given control surface.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to return the number of independent variables for a given control surface.
controlSurface
Name of control surface for which the number of independent variables is to be retrieved.
Number of independent variables for selected control surface.

briefdescription.para: Function to get the list of independent variables for all control surfaces.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to get the list of independent variables for all control surfaces
List of independent variables for all control surfaces, with map key denoting control surface identifier

briefdescription.para: Function to get the identifier for a single independent variable for a single control surface.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to get the identifier for a single independent variable for a single control surface
controlSurface
Control surface identifier.
index
Index of independent variable of control surface
Identifier for a requested independent variable for requested control surface

briefdescription.para: Base class to hold an aerodynamic coefficient interface.

detaileddescription.para: This interface can, for instance, be a database of coefficients or an aerodynamic analysis code which generates coefficients. The aerodynamic coefficients are defined as a function of any number of independent variables, the physical meaning of which is stored in the coefficient interface.
